Entry points to detailed information
Cards serve as previews and signposts to more detailed information. Keep them concise
and easy to read, providing just enough detail to encourage users to explore further on
the linked page.

A bento grid using Shoppable image, Card and Text overlay card.
Card content
Text Overlay Cards are used as entry points to other pages. Text may overflow onto
multiple lines. Ensure titles are kept short (approximately 60 characters).
The gradient overlay expands vertically with the title - longer text results in more of the
image being darkened to maintain good text contrast.
For further guidance, refer to our writing principles in this guide.

(] A simple, bite-sized title, communicating the key information of the card's (1) Avoid using the card's title to overwhelm the user with information that could be
destination content. communicated on the linked page.
Image content in cards
Cards are designed for inspirational images. Avoid using isolated or solitary product
images, as they may appear disconnected from the accompanying text. Additionally,
product images tend to have very narrow white margins.
Isolated product images should always be displayed with a price and product
information.
You can find more information about presentation techniques for the range on the Visa
Digital Retail Experience Hub.

(] Use inspirational images. (1) Don't use isolated product images in cards.
Consistent image aspect ratios
When displaying multiple cards in a row or grid, for visual consistency, the images
should all be displayed with the same image aspect ratio.

(] Images in cards displayed in a carousel, row or grid should all use the same image aspect ratio.
Behaviours
Hit areas
The entire card acts as an interactive area. Tapping anywhere on the card takes the user
to the card's destination. If the media container contains a video, the hit areas are
divided.

The hit area is dependent on which content the media container holds. When the card contains an image, the whole card will be clickable, while video will separate the areas.
